faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Common questions about our Fake Ubuntu Update Screen

whatIs.question: What is the Fake Ubuntu Update Screen?
whatIs.answer: It's a web-based simulator that imitates the Ubuntu update process. It looks like a real Linux terminal running system updates, but it's just for fun or educational use.

safe.question: Is it safe?
safe.answer: Yes. It doesn't run any actual commands or change your files ‚Äî it's purely visual. Everything happens inside your browser.

pranks.question: Can I use it to prank someone?
pranks.answer: Of course üòÑ Go full screen, leave it running, and watch your friends panic when they think their Ubuntu system is "upgrading" itself.

exit.question: How do I exit the fake update screen?
exit.answer: Simply press Esc or F11 to exit full-screen mode.

devices.question: Does it work on Windows or macOS?
devices.answer: Yes, the fake Ubuntu update screen works on any modern browser ‚Äî Chrome, Edge, Firefox, or Safari ‚Äî no matter which OS you're using.

real.question: Can I use it for teaching or demos?
real.answer: Definitely. IT instructors and tech YouTubers often use this simulator to explain how the Linux update process looks, without needing a real Ubuntu installation.

content.question: Does it really update my system?
content.answer: No ‚Äî it's only a visual simulator, not a real terminal. Your system remains completely unchanged.
